text: Framlingham is a small town in the Suffolk Coastal local government district of Suffolk, England. Framlingham Castle is a large hill-top castle found in the town. It has a population of 3,114 at the 2001 census.Office for National Statistics : Census 2001 : Parish Headcounts : Suffolk Coastal Retrieved 2009-11-15 There used to be a railway station there but it is now closed. ==References== Category:Towns in Suffolk Category:Civil parishes in Suffolk Category:Suffolk Coastal
title: Framlingham
